definition: (bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]

sentences.english: Some argue that it originates from the Zulu for 'making a loud noise'.
sentences.chinese: 有人说是来源于祖鲁语中“制造噪音”的说法。

sentences.english: The same could be argued of the Zulu War of 1879.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，1879年的祖鲁战争也有着相同的性质。

sentences.english: The Zulus conquered all the neighboring tribes.
sentences.chinese: 祖鲁人征服了所有邻近的群落。

sentences.english: A Zulu waitress is serving local barbecues for her customers.
sentences.chinese: 一位祖鲁族女招待正在为顾客端上当地特色的烤肉。

sentences.english: Oneof the first things Johnny taught us was a Zulu warrior greeting.
sentences.chinese: 约翰尼首先教我们做祖鲁勇士的问候礼。

sentences.english: The word comes from the Zulu and Xhosa languages.
sentences.chinese: 该词来自于祖鲁语和科萨语。

sentences.english: Destroy roadblock at waypoint Zulu with a satchel charge.
sentences.chinese: 用炸药包把祖鲁航点的路障摧毁。

sentences.english: He spent his childhood in Natal and Zululand.
sentences.chinese: 他花了他的童年在产前和祖鲁兰。

sentences.english: And so it proved with this year's Zulu reed dance in South Africa。
sentences.chinese: 今年南非祖鲁的“芦苇节”就是一例。

sentences.english: To this day young Zulu boys practise fighting.
sentences.chinese: 直到现在年轻的祖鲁男孩还练习格斗。

sentences.english: All were from KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 所有女性均来自南非的夸祖鲁纳塔尔。

sentences.english: The Zulus conquered all the neighboring tribes.
sentences.chinese: 祖鲁人征服了所有邻近的部落。

sentences.english: We've been studying Zulu chants of South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 我们一直在研究南非祖鲁人的圣歌。

sentences.english: This Zulu Proverb can be applied to leadership in Africa today.
sentences.chinese: 今天，祖鲁族人这句谚语可以应用到非洲的领导身上。

sentences.english: He is being treated at a hospital in Erzurum Province.
sentences.chinese: 他目前正在埃尔祖鲁姆省一所医院接受治疗。

sentences.english: The war ended the Zulu nation's independence.
sentences.chinese: 战争终结了祖鲁作为独立国家的历史。

definition: headman (of primitive people)/tribal chief/used as translation for foreign leaders, e.g. Indian Rajah or Arab Sheik or Emir
Basay, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan/Maasai people of Kenya
Acre, city in Israel, also known as Akko
Punjab state of India/Punjab province of Pakistan
Sudan/sultan (ruler of some Muslim states, esp. Ottoman Emperor)
